citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A Patagonian Cavy was euthanized due to a fracture leg that was left to heal on its own. Facility representative stated the
injury started as a small injury on the lower leg and after it healed when the animal put weight on it the bone protruded
through. Veterinary care was not provided after bone was seen. Attempts were made to place the cavy in a travel carrier,
but facility was not able to do so and the Attending veterinarian was not contacted. The attending veterinarian came 6
months after the first injury was seen and performed a walkthrough the facility on March 9, 2023. The attending
veterinarian recommended that the facility take the Patagonian Cavy to the local veterinarian hospital for diagnostics and
possible surgery. The cavy was euthanized at the veterinary hospital. The facility also elected to transfer their Patagonian
Cavy population to another licensed facility to better care for their animals. Injuries and any abnormalities seen must be
reported to the Attending veterinarian as soon as they are noticed. Daily observation of all animals and direct and frequent
communication with the attending veterinarian is required so that care can be provided in a timely matter. Corrected at the
time of inspection.

The enclosure housing two crab-eating macaques had multiple swing structures that were covered with dry green and
black residue consistent with algae and mold. These areas of porous green-black residue make ideal locations for
bacteria to collect and grow and can cause disease. The surfaces of housing facilities must be constructed in a matter
that allows the surfaces to be readily cleaned and sanitized, or removed or replaced when worned or soiled. Corrected by
August 14, 2023.

The enclosure containing one racoon had multiple sharp points in the location where the racoon was resting. The sharp
edges were noticed when viewing the racoon resting in an unusual manner. Sharp rusted points were seen directly above
and below the racoon. After a few minutes the racoon was able to move unharmed from his resting place. Sharp points
can cause injuries and be detrimental to the wellbeing and welfare of the animal. The enclosure must be kept in good
repair to prevent the animal from injury.
Corrected by September 25, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
Additional Inspectors:
KRISTIN NAPOLI, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Critical
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A Patagonian Cavy was euthanized due to a fracture leg that was left to heal on its own. Facility representative stated the 
injury started as a small injury on the lower leg and after it healed when the animal put weight on it the bone protruded

but facility was not able to do so and the Attending veterinarian was not contacted. The attending veterinarian came 6

veterinarian recommended that the facility take the Patagonian Cavy to the local veterinarian hospital for diagnostics and

communication with the attending veterinarian is required so that care can be provided in a timely matter. Corrected at the

3.75(c)(1) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The enclosure housing two crab-eating macaques had multiple swing structures that were covered with dry green and 
black residue consistent with algae and mold. These areas of porous green-black residue make ideal locations for 
bacteria to collect and grow and can cause disease. The surfaces of housing facilities must be constructed in a matter 
that allows the surfaces to be readily cleaned and sanitized, or removed or replaced when worned or soiled. Corrected by 
August 14, 2023. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The enclosure containing one racoon had multiple sharp points in the location where the racoon was resting. The sharp 
edges were noticed when viewing the racoon resting in an unusual manner. Sharp rusted points were seen directly above 
and below the racoon. After a few minutes the racoon was able to move unharmed from his resting place. Sharp points 
can cause injuries and be detrimental to the wellbeing and welfare of the animal. The enclosure must be kept in good 
repair to prevent the animal from injury.  
Corrected by September 25, 2023.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
KRISTIN NAPOLI, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
